abstract: Citigroup may seek to take over its Japanese investment-banking venture with Nikko Cordial after an accounting scandal led to the resignation of six top Nikko executives, Bloomberg News reported. Nikko, Japan’s third-biggest securities firm, admitted to overstating earnings in 2004 and an outside panel found evidence of fraud. Furthermore, the Tokyo-based company, whose shares have dropped 19 percent since Dec. 15, may lose its stock-market listing.
lead_paragraph: Citigroup may seek to take over its Japanese investment-banking venture with Nikko Cordial after an accounting scandal led to the resignation of six top Nikko executives, Bloomberg News reported. Nikko, Japan’s third-biggest securities firm, admitted to overstating earnings in 2004 and an outside panel found evidence of fraud. Furthermore, the Tokyo-based company, whose shares have dropped 19 percent since Dec. 15, may lose its stock-market listing.

headline.main: Citigroup May Take Nikko Matters into Its Own Hands
